result.name: 2016-scottish-natural-heritage-snh-south-skye-sealochs-benthic-camera-and-infaunal-grab-survey2
result.notes: This survey work consisted of drop down video and infaunal grab sampling, carried out by SNH in collaboration with SEPA on board the SV Sir John Murray, throughout South Skye Sea Lochs Eishort, Slapin, Scavaig, and Soay Sound. The primary objective of this survey was to fill data gaps - improving knowledge on the distribution biotopes of recognised conservation importance. A total of 42 video stations and 10 grab stations were surveyed over two days in August 2016.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: 2016 Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH) South Skye Sealochs benthic camera and infaunal grab survey

extras.value: ["Not for use in navigation. This survey recorded no species or biotope occurrences that SNH consider as sensitive; all records may therefore be released in response to requests covered by Environmental Information Regulations or Freedom of Information Regulations; additionally its re-use and dissemination is permissible under Open Government Licence terms. Any re-use of this data will acknowledge the copyright owner."]
Precision Marine Survey Limited (originator); Colin Moore (originator); Scottish Natural Heritage (SNH), Headquaters (custodian)
